title: October 30: School Visit
description: Practice connecting with students, parents, and educators in a neutral, nonpartisan setting. Balance empathy, authority, and clarity while reinforcing community values.

tasks.prompt: Deliver a 1–2 paragraph speech to the school audience, demonstrating empathy, clarity, and message discipline.
Parent Dialogue: Engage with Linda, a concerned parent, and respond to safety and education policy questions respectfully and reassuringly.
Principal’s Office Ensemble: Mediate a discussion with Dr. Howard, Mrs. Arnold, and Karen, balancing multiple perspectives while offering a clear stance on school safety policies.
Classroom Visit: Respond to playful, curious students (ages 8–11) about school safety and local concerns in an age-appropriate manner.

narrator: School visits test your ability to connect across generations — parents, teachers, and students. Clear, respectful communication builds trust and approval.
readingSummary: Candidates interact with parents, administrators, and students in a neutral, safe school setting.
Success depends on empathy, authority, clarity, and consistent messaging.

tasksDetails.prompt: Deliver a concise, inclusive speech addressing education and community safety.
Engage with the parent character, Linda, providing reassurance and policy clarity.
Mediate the discussion in the principal’s office ensemble, balancing multiple adult perspectives.
Address student questions about safety in an age-appropriate and engaging way.

sources: General Election October 30 – School Visit Scenario

outcome.description: AI evaluates tone, clarity, and empathy. Voter approval adjusts based on parent, administrator, and student interactions. Demonstrates multi-stakeholder communication skills.
